contentList.content: Well worn clothes, been through alot and still going strong.

Pugilists are self-taught warriors that have created their own unorthodox martial art; rather than specializing in long storied techniques or mystical energy, they focus on being able to take and deliver any number of blows needed to win a fight.
Your experience laying the beatdown on others has given you a Moxie you can channel in the midst of battle. Moxie is used to fuel various Pugilist abilities.

Pugilists unconsciously tap into their own inner strength in the form of moxie. This is not an esoteric or mystical energy that flows through the multiverse, but the result of determination forged over a lifetime of hardship with anever-say-die attitude.
You gain another <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="757_Moxie">Moxie</LSTag> to fuel your Pugilist techniques.
You can make an unarmed attack as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> this turn.
All melee attacks against you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Make another unarmed attack as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Throw a rapid pair of blows.

Brace for attacks. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your Fisticuffs die ([2]) + your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> ([3]) + your Pugilist Class Level ([1]).
Use a defensive movement technique. All melee attacks against you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

Your body is resilient as armor. While not wearing armor, your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armor Class</LSTag> is equal to 12 + your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.

Attacks with <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon"> Pugilist Weapons </LSTag> and unarmed attacks deal [1], unless their normal damage is higher. You must be wearing Light or no armor, and not wielding a shield to gain this benefit.

After making an attack with a <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon">Pugilist Weapon </LSTag> or while unarmed, you can make an unarmed attack as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>. You must be wearing Light or no armor, and not wielding a shield to gain this benefit.
Pugilist weapons are those with which the Pugilist has <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag>, and do not have the <LSTag Tooltip="TwoHanded">two-handed</LSTag> or heavy properties.

Pugilists in the Arena Royale fight club earn their keep as equal parts performer and gladiator. Whether performing in a show or fighting it out after, pugilists in the Arena Royale care as much about the theatrics of a fight as they do its outcome.

Pugilists in the Bloodhound Bruisers fight club are notorious for looking for trouble and finding it every time. Members of this fight club are highly observant of character traits and physical evidence, allowing them to easily read the battlefield and their opponents.

Pugilists in the Piss and Vinegar fight club revel in their reputations as heels. Widely despised for their obscene curses and dirty tricks, these pugilists take pride in their ability to provoke, and fight to win at all costs.

Experienced in the art of hitting the floor, pugilists in The Squared Circle fight club know that being knocked down can make or break a fight. Having mastered ways to turn the tables, these pugilists make sure their opponents will be the ones looking up at the end.

Pugilists who practice the Sweet Science hit hard, fast, and often. From Upper Class entertainment bouts, to back alley brawls where their next breath depends on a knockout, these Pugilists are more than willing to teach what their fists can do.

When you take damage that reduces you to half your maximum hit points or less, you may use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to three times your pugilist level and regain all your expended Moxie. Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short </LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest.</LSTag>
Gained [1] <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> and all expended Moxie.
Gain [1] <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> and regain all your expended Moxie.
You discover a strength inside you that canâ€™t be broken. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant"> Resistance</LSTag> to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

When attacking with an unarmed attack or a <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon">Pugilist Weapon</LSTag> you may swing a wild Haymaker. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on the attack roll, and deal the maximum result of your weaponâ€™s damage die instead of rolling.
Your unarmed attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming enemies' <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to non-magical damage.

If you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SG_Charmed">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SG_Frightened">Frightened</LSTag>, you automatically cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="757_Shout_ShakeItOff">Shake It Off</LSTag> to remove the condition.
Shake Off the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SG_Charmed">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SG_Frightened">Frightened</LSTag> condition, removing it.

Add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to the damage of your unarmed strikes and <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon"> Pugilist Weapons </LSTag> for the next minute. This also applies the benefits of Bloodied But Unbowed.

When you use your Bloodied But Unbowed feature, you can choose to also use this feature. If you do, you add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to the damage of your unarmed strikes and <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon"> Pugilist Weapons </LSTag> for the next minute. Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest.</LSTag>
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is added to the damage of your unarmed strikes and <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon"> Pugilist Weapons.</LSTag>
Somehow, after countless time busting heads against the streets, you've connected both meanings of "Smarts". You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Psychic damage.

You've seen and learned how to do some terrible stuff over the years. Those things don't bother you anymore. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SG_Stunned">Stunned</LSTag>

You make a leaping jump attack on a target, on a hit they are knocked <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>. Targets nearby must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or also take damage.

You fuel the crowd, as much as they fuel you. In combat, allies within 10ft of you gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> on the start of your turn.

Allies within 10 feet of you gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> at the start of your turn.
The crowd has heard combat, Roar of the Crowd is now active.

A Pugilist is putting on a show! Your excitment gives you <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to the Pugilist's <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>
You have a +3 to initiative, along with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on attack rolls against creatures that havenâ€™t acted yet in combat.
Attack a target, potenially leaving them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DAZED">Dazed</LSTag>.
The target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> to hit the source. The source has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> to hit the target.

Hone in on the idiosyncrasies and bad habits of an enemy. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on weapon attacks against the target and the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> to hit you.

Youâ€™ve turned spewing insults into an art, you learn an enchanced version of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ViciousMockery">Vicious Mockery</LSTag> cantrip, allowing you to cast it with a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>. In addition, you can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bane">Bane</LSTag> at first level once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Distract a foe with a strange dance and song, then quickly hit them below the belt and sweep their feet; potenially knocking them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>. You regain 1 Moxie.
Throw your trusty pocket sand, potenially <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinding</LSTag> all targets hit. You regain 1 Moxie.
Pick up an item or enemy and throw it at a target, knocking them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> and dealing additional damage.
After you <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove">Shove</LSTag> an enemy, you gain a +2 to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armor Class</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.
Your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armor Class</LSTag> is increased by 2.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> using <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag>.

You cannot be pushed against your will, and you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained.</LSTag>

Reduce damage by 1d10 + your Strength Modifier + Pugilist Level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you may spend 1 Moxie to Cross.
Dodge the brunt of a melee attack and retaliate with a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Counter_757">Cross</LSTag>.

You may use your reaction to reduce the damage from a melee weapon attack by 1d10 + your Strength Modifier + Pugilist Level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you may spend 1 Moxie to Counter.
Throw a punch while your oppenent is committed to an attack.
Deliver a brutal uppercut, dealing Piercing damage, and making the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">Bleed</LSTag>.
Some people think they can take anything, you know you can prove em wrong. Your unarmed attacks ignore Bludgeoning <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag>.

So many things that you can't use as a weapon just get in the way of a fight, lucky for you they're real easy to hit.Your unarmed attacks are automatically <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag> on objects.

Your unarmed attacks and <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="757_PugilistWeapon"> Pugilist Weapons </LSTag> hit hard enough to send your target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_ATTACK_DEBUFF">Reeling</LSTag> for 1 turn.
